answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.In Small vessel disease the lumen of the small blood vessels is narrowed causing a decrease in flow. Depending on the areas of brain affected, symptoms could range from weakness of limbs, difficulty walking, problems with speech, memory problems and loss of sensation. Therapy is focused on improving blood flow with medications like Plavix. Controlling diabetes and hypertension and following good lifestyle measures can help control the narrowing. Regular exercise and avoiding fatty foods can help to increase the flow through the calcified arteries.Please discuss this with your doctor am sure he will provide further assistance.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.
